description: RCP2.6. A pathway that aims to limit global warming to below 2°C above pre-industrial levels, with significant reductions in greenhouse gas emissions.
RCP4.5. A stabilization scenario where greenhouse gas emissions peak around 2040 and then decline, leading to a moderate level of warming.
RCP8.5. A high greenhouse gas emissions scenario with continued reliance on fossil fuels, leading to significant global warming (potentially exceeding 4°C).
